newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde March 3.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde March 3.

text.p: These are leading stories in today's afternoon daily Le Monde, dated March 4.
-- President Jacques Chirac says tough new immigration bill will help fight far-right extremism.
-- Renault expected to lay off 3,000 in France this year and 3,100 in Belgium.
-- Vilvoorde mayor Willy Cortois calls on EU Commissioner Karel van Miert to start proceedings against Renault assembly plant shutdown.
-- Peugeot negotiating with China's Guangzhou Automobile Group to withdraw "this month" from joint venture where production of outdated 304 and 505 models was halted months ago.
-- Societe Generale chairman Marc Vienot says a bid for Credit Lyonnais is "not on the agenda now".
